description: The Dancing Fountains of Batumi are one of the largest dancing fountain installations in Europe and a hallmark attraction of Georgia's Black Sea coast. Originally installed in 1977 by Georgian architect Giorgi Erkomaishvili with Armenian engineers, these spectacular water features combine synchronized water jets, colorful lights, and music to create mesmerizing evening performances. The main installation at Ardagani Lake was enhanced in 2009 with French musical fountain technology, featuring a three-dimensional laser show. The fountains are located at three key locations: the Old Boulevard, Ardagani Lake (the largest), and Europe Square.
highlights: One of the largest dancing fountain systems in Europe
Three separate fountain locations throughout Batumi city center
Synchronized water jets, colorful lights, and music performances
Three-dimensional laser show at Ardagani Lake creating illusions of dancing water
Musical repertoire includes Georgian songs and international masterpieces by Luciano Pavarotti, Barry White, Diana Ross, and Sting
Shows run nightly from 9 PM to 2 AM with performances every 30 minutes
Performances feature modern pop, rock, and classical music
15-20 minute show duration with graceful water streams that curve, spiral, and cascade
Historic installation dating back to 1977 with modern 2009 French technology upgrade
tips: Arrive 15-20 minutes early to secure a good viewing spot, especially during peak tourist season
Best viewing times are just after sunset around 9 PM when the lights create maximum visual impact
The Ardagani Lake location offers the most spectacular show with the three-dimensional laser display
Viewing areas around the lake provide plenty of space to sit, walk, or enjoy snacks from nearby food stalls
Perfect for photography - arrive during sunset for the best lighting conditions
Water reflections at Ardagani Lake create excellent photo opportunities with surrounding modern buildings
Shows run until 2 AM, so you can enjoy the performance at a less crowded later time
The wooden bridge near Sunset Batumi restaurant at Ardagani Lake offers a unique vantage point
Combine your visit with a stroll along the Boulevard to see fountains at all three locations
Modern cafes and restaurants surround Ardagani Lake for refreshments before or after the show
vibe: Magical and romantic evening entertainment. The Dancing Fountains create an enchanting atmosphere as water, light, and music merge into artistic performances. The shows attract families, couples, and tourists who gather along the waterfront to witness the synchronized spectacle. With performances running late into the night, the fountains keep Batumi's Boulevard alive and entertaining, offering a perfect blend of natural beauty and technological artistry. The surrounding modern architecture and Black Sea backdrop add to the sophisticated coastal resort atmosphere, making this a must-see attraction that captures Batumi's transformation into a premier tourist destination.

interesting_facts: Recognized as one of the largest dancing fountain systems in Europe
The original installation has been entertaining visitors since 1977
Features international music from legendary artists including Pavarotti and Sting alongside Georgian masterpieces
The French technology upgrade in 2009 added cutting-edge laser projection capabilities
Performances run continuously for 5 hours every night, making it one of the longest-running fountain shows
The three locations allow visitors to experience different fountain styles throughout the city
Ardagani Lake is an artificial lake specifically designed to showcase the fountain technology
